name: Mollinedia arianeae
typeLocations: holotype P P01167582;isotype F;isotype E;isotype GH;isotype K;isotype L;isotype MA;isotype LZ LZ177460;isotype MO MO100910703;isotype NY NY02692301;isotype W W20150005057, W20150005058
distribution: Rio de Janeiro (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: Serra da Mantiqueira, Maciço do Itatiaia, Parque Nacional do Itatiaia; entre a cascata de Maromba e cascata Véu de Noiva
remarks: doi:10.5252/adansonia2023v45a6 Etymology: In honour of Dr Ariane Luna Peixoto (Instituto Jardim Botânico do Rio de Janeiro).

name: Mollinedia fatimae
typeLocations: holotype SPF;isotype ALCB;isotype B;isotype BHCB;isotype BHZB;isotype DIAM;isotype HUFU;isotype HURB;isotype K;isotype MEXU;isotype MO;isotype NY;isotype OUPR;isotype P;isotype PTBR;isotype RB;isotype UB
distribution: Minas Gerais (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: Ouro Preto, Parque Estadual do Itacolomi, mata em frente à capela, 1343 m
remarks: doi:10.3897/phytokeys.234.109804 Etymology: name is an homage to Dra. Fátima Otavina de Souza Buturi, an inspiring Brazilian botanist who dedicates her career studying Asteraceae.

name: Mollinedia jorgeorum
reference: Arch. Jard. Bot. Rio de Janeiro 27: 194, fig. 2. 1988 [dt.  1983-85; publ. Nov 1988] (as jorgearum)
publication: Arch. Jard. Bot. Rio de Janeiro
remarks: Eponymy: Jorge Fontella Pereira, Jorge Pedro Pereira Carauta e Jorge Yoshio Tamashiro.” Date of publication: the inside back cover shows Rio, 11/88. Page 197 shows a reference as Peixoto, A.L. 1987; pages 184 and 189 show a collection date as 1985. From these dates, it is evident that the publication was issued in November 1988

name: Mollinedia pignalii
typeLocations: holotype RB RB01108310;isotype P;isotype SPF;isotype MBML
distribution: Espírito Santo (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)
locality: Santa Maria de Jetibá, Fazenda Azaléa, Bonito River, fragment near the coffee plantation
remarks: doi:10.1590/1677-941X-ABB-2023-0174 Etymology: The specific epithet pays homage to Marc Pignal, French botanist of the Muséum National d'Histoire Naturelle, Paris.
